Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Circular Pottery Naos
Description: The circular pottery naos, or small shrine, has an open base and opening. Two columns, each of which has a base and a capital, restrict the door on one side. An arch in the shape of a palm frond is above the door. The naos was painted in white to enable the drawing of a scene on it. Large quantities of pottery were found in Egypt due to the abundance of raw materials. Many pieces of pottery were decorated with ornaments, scenes, and animals such as rabbits, pigeons, lions, gazelles, and fish.
